intro: Lithocarpus echinops, commonly known as the spiny stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a spiny cupule. Its botanical features make it well adapted to tropical and subtropical forest environments. The tree is also valued for its durable wood and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
